sentences.en: A guardian of the person is entitled to regulate his education.
sentences.cn: 人身监护人有权安排他的教育.

sentences.en: A stunt man needs to have a good guardian angel.
sentences.cn: 当特技替身演员的得有个守护天使来保佑.

sentences.en: Before the Chronicle I used to take the Guardian.
sentences.cn: 在订阅《纪事报》以前，我看的是《卫报》。

sentences.en: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.cn: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

sentences.en: He was furious with his guardian for going back on his word.
sentences.cn: 他对监护人的出尔反尔,大发其火.

sentences.en: In the last resort a minor may elect a guardian himself.
sentences.cn: 最后一种办法是未成年人可以自己选择监护人.

sentences.en: Mr English, an associate editor of the Guardian, is a polymath who wears his learning lightly.
sentences.cn: 英格力士先生是《卫报》的副编辑，是一位略显才华的博学者。

sentences.en: The form must be signed by the child's parents or guardian.
sentences.cn: 这张表格须由孩子的家长或监护人签字.

sentences.en: The guardian read his ward a sermon on his extravagance.
sentences.cn: 监护人严词申斥被监护人挥霍浪费.

sentences.en: The Guardian's front page carries a photograph of the two foreign ministers.
sentences.cn: 《卫报》的头版刊登了两国外交部长的一张合影。

sentences.en: The ill-advised conceit of the guardian angel dooms the film from the start.
sentences.cn: 对守护天使的蹩脚设计弄巧成拙，从一开始就注定这部电影要失败。

sentences.en: The legal guardian must act on behalf of the child.
sentences.cn: 法定监护人应该维护这个孩子的利益.

sentences.en: The Turkish situation makes the lead in tomorrow's Guardian.
sentences.cn: 土耳其局势将成为明天《卫报》的头条。

sentences.en: Their uncle was declared guardian to the orphans.
sentences.cn: 这些孤儿的叔父成为他们的监护人.

sentences.en: Those documents are now in the possession of the Guardian.
sentences.cn: 那些文件目前在《卫报》手里。

sentences.en: To be a friend as well as a guardian of the people.
sentences.cn: 即是人民的守卫者,也是人民的朋友.

trans.tran_cn: 监护人，保护者，维护者，法国修道院院长
trans.tran_en: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died
